info.description: The Adyen Terminal API lets you make payments, issue refunds, collect shopper information, and perform other shopper-terminal interactions using a payment terminal supplied by Adyen.
info.title: Adyen Terminal API

post.description: It conveys the data to print and the way to process the print. It contains the complete content to print. Content of the Print Request message.

schema.description: It conveys the data to print and the way to process the print. It contains the complete content to print. Content of the Print Request message.

schema.description: It conveys the result of the print, parallel to the message request, except if response not required and absent. Content of the Print Response message.

StartDate.description: Date time of the beginning of an operation.

CardData.description: Allows acquisition of the card data by the Sale System before the Payment, CardAcquisition  or BalanceInquiry request to the POI. PaymentToken.description: Surrogate of the PAN (Primary Account Number) of the payment card to  identify the payment mean of the customer. It allows, for a merchant, to identify   the customer.

ExpiryDateTime.description: Expiry date and time. Limits the validity of a payment token.

SensitiveCardData.description: This data structure could be CMS protected (EnvelopedData). In this case the data structure SensitiveCardData is replaced by the data structure ProtectedCardData of type ContentInformationType. When this data is protected, the exact content is unknown by the Sale System, and might include all the information which are required by an external backup POI Server to make a batch payment transaction in case of problem with the POI System. Sensitive information related to the payment card, entered or read by the Sale System.

CardSeqNumb.description: if EntryMode is File, Keyed or Manual.

items.description: ISO 7813 - ISO 4909.  Generic data structure for a card track, used when the magstripe card reader is located on the Sale Terminal, or for magstripe Card Reader device request. The data structure is also used to store the line at the bottom of a bank check. Magnetic track or magnetic ink characters line.

CheckData.description: Allows the check information to be provided by the Sale System before requesting the payment, or stored by the Sale System after processing of the payment. Information related to the paper check used for the transaction.

Country.description: Absent if country of the Sale system.

TrackData.description: ISO 7813 - ISO 4909.  Generic data structure for a card track, used when the magstripe card reader is located on the Sale Terminal, or for magstripe Card Reader device request. The data structure is also used to store the line at the bottom of a bank check. Magnetic track or magnetic ink characters line.

APDUPar2.description: Parameter 2 field of the APDU command(P2).

APDUData.description: Data field of the APDU command (Lc + Data).

CheckData.description: Allows the check information to be provided by the Sale System before requesting the payment, or stored by the Sale System after processing of the payment. Information related to the paper check used for the transaction.

Country.description: Absent if country of the Sale system.

TrackData.description: ISO 7813 - ISO 4909.  Generic data structure for a card track, used when the magstripe card reader is located on the Sale Terminal, or for magstripe Card Reader device request. The data structure is also used to store the line at the bottom of a bank check. Magnetic track or magnetic ink characters line.

CoinsOrBills.description: Indicates the remaining number of coins or bills of a given value in a cash handling device. When the cash handling machine does not have any more coins or bills of a certain value, the number must be equal to 0. Number of coins or bills of a given value.

UnitValue.description: Value of a coin or bill.

CurrencyConversion.description: A currency conversion occurred in the payment, and the merchant needs to know information related to this conversion (e.g. to print on the sale receipt). Information related to a currency conversion.

CustomerApprovedFlag.description: Notify if the customer has approved something. Indicates if the customer has accepted a currency conversion.

Declaration.description: If a declaration has to be presented to the customer.

Markup.description: Markup of a currency conversion amount as a percentage.

CustomerOrder.description: Customer order attached to a customer, recorded in the POI system.  Allows the management of customer orders by the POI, for instance in a multi-channel or a click and collect sale transaction.

CurrentAmount.description: Total amount of all completed transactions of a customer order.

CustomerOrderID.description: Additional and optional identification of a customer order.

EndDate.description: Date time of the end of an operation.

StartDate.description: Date time of the beginning of an operation.

HostDiagnosisFlag.description: Indicates if Host Diagnosis are required.

CustomerOrderID.description: Additional and optional identification of a customer order.

SaleTerminalData.description: In the Login Request, if a Sale Terminal is involved in the login. In other messages, when a logical device is out of order (SaleCapabilites), or when the other data have changed since or were not in the Login. Information related to the software and hardware feature of the Sale Terminal.

TotalsGroupID.description: If present, default value for all transaction.

SaleToAcquirerData.description: Send to the Acquirer if present.

SaleToIssuerData.description: The POI System receives this information and sends it to the Acquirer for the Issuer without any change. Sale information intended for the Issuer.

StatementReference.description: Information to print on the bank statement.

SaleTransactionID.description: Identification of a transaction for the Sale System or the POI System.

ShiftNumber.description: if different from the Login and  see Login .SaleData.

LoyaltyResult.description: In the Message Response, the result of each loyalty brand transaction. Data related to the result of a processed loyalty transaction.

CurrentBalance.description: if known (provided by the card or an external host).

LoyaltyAccount.description: This data structure conveys the identification of the account and the associated loyalty brand. Data related to a loyalty account processed in the transaction.

LoyaltyAccountID.description: In the Payment or the Loyalty Request message, it allows to identify the loyalty account by the Sale Terminal instead of the POI Terminal (e.g. because the account identification is a bar-code read by the Cashier on a scanner device). Identification of a Loyalty account.

LoyaltyTransactionID.description: Identification of a transaction for the Sale System or the POI System.

LoyaltyAmount.description: An awarded amount or an amount to redeem to the loyalty account might be sent in the Payment request message. Amount of a loyalty account.

items.description: To be differentiated from the award which is the amount or quantity earned on the loyalty account. The awarded amount that is attached to an item as a rebate.

ItemAmount.description: if rebate on the line item amount.

ItemID.description: Item identification inside a transaction (0 to n).

ProductCode.description: Product code of item purchased with the transaction.

LoyaltyTotals.description: Totals of the loyalty transaction during the reconciliation period.

TransactionAmount.description: Sum of amount of processed transaction during the period.

TransactionCount.description: Number of processed transaction during the period.

OriginalPOITransaction.description: In the Payment or the Loyalty Request message, it allows using the card of a previous CardAcquisition or Payment/Loyalty request. Identification of a previous POI transaction.

AcquirerID.description: Restrict to these Acquirer if present.

CustomerLanguage.description: If the language is selected by the Sale System before the request to the POI.

POIID.description: If original transaction is coming from another POI.

ReuseCardDataFlag.description: Indicate if the card data has to be got from a previous transaction.

SaleID.description: Identification of a Sale System or a Sale Terminal for the Sale to POI protocol.

items.description: In loyalty or value added payment card transaction, the items of the sale are entering in the processing of the transaction. Sale items of a transaction.

AdditionalProductInfo.description: If data sent, POI has to store it and send it if the host protocol allows it.

EanUpc.description: If data sent, POI has to store it and send it if the host protocol allows it.

ItemAmount.description: Total amount of the item line.

ProductCode.description: Product code of item purchased with the transaction.

Quantity.description: If data sent, POI has to store it and send it if the host protocol allows it.

TaxCode.description: If data sent, POI has to store it and send it if the host protocol allows it.

MerchantCategoryCode.description: The payment implies a specific MCC.

MenuEntry.description: It conveys message text and parameters of the menu entry. This output data could be only provided for an input command, in order to choose an entryof the menu. An entryof the menu to present to the Cashier.

MenuEntryTag.description: Characteristics related to the selection of a menu entry.

items.description: It conveys Information related to the content of the text message and its format. All the data elements related to the format of the text to display or print are parameters valid for the whole Text content. Content of text message to display or print.

ReferenceID.description: Identification of a predefined message to display or print.

ProtocolVersion.description: If MessageCategory is Login or Diagnosis.

SaleID.description: Identification of a Sale System or a Sale Terminal for the Sale to POI protocol.

ServiceID.description: Required if Service or Event MessageClass message or if Device MessageClass and request from POI or response from Sale.

MessageReference.description: To abort a transaction in progress or to request the status of a transaction from which no response has been received.  It identifies the message header of the message request to abort or request the status. Identification of a previous POI transaction.

DeviceID.description: Identification of a device message pair.

POIID.description: default MessageHeader.POIID.

SaleID.description: default MessageHeader.SaleID.

ServiceID.description: Identification of a message pair, which processes a transaction.

MobileData.description: Mobile phone is used as a payment instrument for the transaction. Information related to the mobile for the payment transaction.

Response.description: If Result is Success, ErrorCondition is absent or not used in the processing of the message. OutputText.description: It conveys Information related to the content of the text message and its format. All the data elements related to the format of the text to display or print are parameters valid for the whole Text content. Content of text message to display or print.

POIData.description: In the Message Response, identification of the POI transaction. Data related to the POI System.

POITransactionID.description: Identification of a transaction for the Sale System or the POI System.

POIStatus.description: Indicate the availability of the POI Terminal components. The data element is absent if the component is not part of the POI Terminal. State of a POI Terminal.

items.description: Indicate the status and the remaining coins and bill in a cash handling device. Status of cash handling device.

CashHandlingOKFlag.description: Indicates if the cash handling device is working and usable.

items.description: Indicates the remaining number of coins or bills of a given value in a cash handling device. When the cash handling machine does not have any more coins or bills of a certain value, the number must be equal to 0. Number of coins or bills of a given value.

UnitValue.description: Value of a coin or bill.

POIStatus.description: Indicate the availability of the POI Terminal components. The data element is absent if the component is not part of the POI Terminal. State of a POI Terminal.

PaymentInstrumentData.description: Sent in the result of the payment transaction. For a card, it could also be sent in the CardAcquisition response, to be processed by the Sale System. Data related to the instrument of payment for the transaction.

CardData.description: Allows acquisition of the card data by the Sale System before the Payment, CardAcquisition  or BalanceInquiry request to the POI. items.description: Product that is payable by the payment card. Product codes that are payable by the payment card.

ProductLabel.description: Product name of an item purchased with the transaction.

items.description: Customer order attached to a customer, recorded in the POI system.  Allows the management of customer orders by the POI, for instance in a multi-channel or a click and collect sale transaction.

CurrentAmount.description: Total amount of all completed transactions of a customer order.

CustomerOrderID.description: Additional and optional identification of a customer order.

EndDate.description: Date time of the end of an operation.

StartDate.description: Date time of the beginning of an operation.

PaymentToken.description: Surrogate of the PAN (Primary Account Number) of the payment card to  identify the payment mean of the customer. It allows, for a merchant, to identify   the customer.

ExpiryDateTime.description: Expiry date and time. Limits the validity of a payment token.

SensitiveCardData.description: This data structure could be CMS protected (EnvelopedData). In this case the data structure SensitiveCardData is replaced by the data structure ProtectedCardData of type ContentInformationType. When this data is protected, the exact content is unknown by the Sale System, and might include all the information which are required by an external backup POI Server to make a batch payment transaction in case of problem with the POI System. Sensitive information related to the payment card, entered or read by the Sale System.

CheckData.description: Allows the check information to be provided by the Sale System before requesting the payment, or stored by the Sale System after processing of the payment. Information related to the paper check used for the transaction.

Country.description: Absent if country of the Sale system.

TrackData.description: ISO 7813 - ISO 4909.  Generic data structure for a card track, used when the magstripe card reader is located on the Sale Terminal, or for magstripe Card Reader device request. The data structure is also used to store the line at the bottom of a bank check. Magnetic track or magnetic ink characters line.

MobileData.description: Mobile phone is used as a payment instrument for the transaction. Information related to the mobile for the payment transaction.

StoredValueAccountID.description: It contains the identifications of the stored value account or the stored value card, and the associated product sold by the Sale System for stored value requests. Identification of the stored value account or the stored value card.

Response.description: If Result is Success, ErrorCondition is absent or not used in the processing of the message. In the other cases, the ErrorCondition has to be present and can refine the processing of the message response. AdditionalResponse gives more information about the success or the failure of the message request processing, for logging without real time involvements. Result of a message request processing.

AdditionalResponse.description: If present, the POI logs it for further examination.

SaleData.description: Data associated to the Sale System, with a particular value during the processing of the payment by the POI, including the cards acquisition. Data related to the Sale System.

CustomerOrderID.description: Additional and optional identification of a customer order.

SaleTerminalData.description: In the Login Request, if a Sale Terminal is involved in the login. In other messages, when a logical device is out of order (SaleCapabilites), or when the other data have changed since or were not in the Login. Information related to the software and hardware feature of the Sale Terminal.

TotalsGroupID.description: If present, default value for all transaction.

SaleToAcquirerData.description: Send to the Acquirer if present.

SaleToIssuerData.description: The POI System receives this information and sends it to the Acquirer for the Issuer without any change. Sale information intended for the Issuer.

StatementReference.description: Information to print on the bank statement.

SaleTransactionID.description: Identification of a transaction for the Sale System or the POI System.

ShiftNumber.description: if different from the Login and  see Login .SaleData.

CardReaderAPDUResponse.description: It contains the result of the requested service, APDU response sent by the chip of the card in response to the APDU request. Content of the Card Reader APDU Response message.

APDUData.description: Data field of the APDU command (Lc + Data).

CardStatusWords.description: Status of a smartcard response to a command (SW1-SW2).

Response.description: If Result is Success, ErrorCondition is absent or not used in the processing of the message. LoyaltyResponse.description: It conveys Information related to the Loyalty transaction processed by the POI System. Content of the Loyalty Response message.

items.description: In the Message Response, the result of each loyalty brand transaction. Data related to the result of a processed loyalty transaction.

CurrentBalance.description: if known (provided by the card or an external host).

LoyaltyAccount.description: This data structure conveys the identification of the account and the associated loyalty brand. Data related to a loyalty account processed in the transaction.

LoyaltyAccountID.description: In the Payment or the Loyalty Request message, it allows to identify the loyalty account by the Sale Terminal instead of the POI Terminal (e.g. because the account identification is a bar-code read by the Cashier on a scanner device). Identification of a Loyalty account.

LoyaltyTransactionID.description: Identification of a transaction for the Sale System or the POI System.

LoyaltyAmount.description: An awarded amount or an amount to redeem to the loyalty account might be sent in the Payment request message. Amount of a loyalty account.

items.description: To be differentiated from the award which is the amount or quantity earned on the loyalty account. The awarded amount that is attached to an item as a rebate.

ItemAmount.description: if rebate on the line item amount.

ItemID.description: Item identification inside a transaction (0 to n).

ProductCode.description: Product code of item purchased with the transaction.

POIData.description: In the Message Response, identification of the POI transaction. Data related to the POI System.

POITransactionID.description: Identification of a transaction for the Sale System or the POI System.

items.description: If the payment receipts are printed by the Sale system and the POI or the Sale does not implement the Print exchange (Basic profile). Customer or Merchant payment receipt.

IntegratedPrintFlag.description: Type of the print integrated to other prints.

OutputContent.description: This is a sequence of elements if they have different formats. Content to display or print.

items.description: It conveys Information related to the content of the text message and its format. All the data elements related to the format of the text to display or print are parameters valid for the whole Text content. Content of text message to display or print.

OutputXHTML.description: Mandatory, if OutputFormat is XHTML, not allowed otherwise.

PredefinedContent.description: It conveys Information related to the predefined message. Reference of a predefined message to display or print.

ReferenceID.description: Identification of a predefined message to display or print.

RequiredSignatureFlag.description: Indicate that the cardholder payment receipt requires a physical signature by the Customer.

RequiredSignatureFlag.description: Indicate that the cardholder payment receipt requires a physical signature by the Customer.

items.description: A currency conversion occurred in the payment, and the merchant needs to know information related to this conversion (e.g. to print on the sale receipt). Information related to a currency conversion.

CustomerApprovedFlag.description: Notify if the customer has approved something. Indicates if the customer has accepted a currency conversion.

Declaration.description: If a declaration has to be presented to the customer.

Markup.description: Markup of a currency conversion amount as a percentage.

PaymentAcquirerData.description: Data related to the response from the payment Acquirer.

AcquirerID.description: If several Acquirers.

AcquirerPOIID.description: Identification of the POI for the payment Acquirer.

AcquirerTransactionID.description: Identification of a transaction for the Sale System or the POI System.

MerchantID.description: Identification of the Merchant for the Acquirer.

PaymentInstrumentData.description: Sent in the result of the payment transaction. For a card, it could also be sent in the CardAcquisition response, to be processed by the Sale System. Data related to the instrument of payment for the transaction.

CardData.description: Allows acquisition of the card data by the Sale System before the Payment, CardAcquisition  or BalanceInquiry request to the POI. It could also be sent in the CardAcquisition response, to be processed by the Sale System. Information related to the payment card used for the transaction.

items.description: Product that is payable by the payment card. Product codes that are payable by the payment card.

AdditionalProductInfo.description: Additionl information related to the line item.

EanUpc.description: Standard product code of item purchased with the transaction.

ProductCode.description: Product code of item purchased with the transaction.

ProductLabel.description: Product name of an item purchased with the transaction.

items.description: Customer order attached to a customer, recorded in the POI system.  Allows the management of customer orders by the POI, for instance in a multi-channel or a click and collect sale transaction.

CurrentAmount.description: Total amount of all completed transactions of a customer order.

CustomerOrderID.description: Additional and optional identification of a customer order.

EndDate.description: Date time of the end of an operation.

StartDate.description: Date time of the beginning of an operation.

PaymentToken.description: Surrogate of the PAN (Primary Account Number) of the payment card to  identify the payment mean of the customer. It allows, for a merchant, to identify   the customer.

ExpiryDateTime.description: Expiry date and time. Limits the validity of a payment token.

SensitiveCardData.description: This data structure could be CMS protected (EnvelopedData). In this case the data structure SensitiveCardData is replaced by the data structure ProtectedCardData of type ContentInformationType. When this data is protected, the exact content is unknown by the Sale System, and might include all the information which are required by an external backup POI Server to make a batch payment transaction in case of problem with the POI System. Sensitive information related to the payment card, entered or read by the Sale System.

CardSeqNumb.description: if EntryMode is File, Keyed or Manual.

SensitiveCardData.description: This data structure could be CMS protected (EnvelopedData). In this case the data structure SensitiveCardData is replaced by the data structure ProtectedCardData of type ContentInformationType. When this data is protected, the exact content is unknown by the Sale System, and might include all the information which are required by an external backup POI Server to make a batch payment transaction in case of problem with the POI System. SensitiveCardData.description: This data structure could be CMS protected (EnvelopedData).
